# isEnabled

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value indicating whether the cell is currently enabled.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var isEnabled: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

The value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] when the cell is enabled or [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] when it is disabled. The text of disabled cells is gray. If a cell is disabled, it cannot be highlighted, does not support mouse tracking (and thus cannot participate in target/action functionality), and cannot be edited. However, you can still alter many attributes of a disabled cell programmatically. (The [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCell/state] property, for instance, still works.)

## Managing Cell Attributes

- **setCellAttribute(_:to:)**: Sets the value for the specified cell attribute.
- **cellAttribute(_:)**: Returns the value for the specified cell attribute.
- **type**: The type of the cell.
- **allowsUndo**: A Boolean value indicating whether the cell assumes responsibility for undo operations.
